bug.author: peteriz
bug.summary: nlp_architect command fails if dev req aren't installed
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Target objective:</denchmark-h>
nlp_architect command fails if dev req aren't installed detect is libraries required are install and print a msg that states the error + how to install <denchmark-h:h4>Steps to objective:</denchmark-h>
fix cmd.py [ ]
<denchmark-h:h4>Pull-Request related:</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Here's some more details about the issue. A few weeks ago, everything worked perfectly fine with version "v0.4.post1". I was able to execute "nlp-architect -v" to see the current version, and also execute the server, and use a web browser to try examples. After I updated to "v0.4.post2" then nothing works. I tried on both Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and 18.02 LTS. On both systems, I'm using the Intel Distro for Python. CPU backend.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/javaspaces>@javaspaces</denchmark-link>
That's true, we've split the required packages needed to operate the library and for development (changing the library). However, we haven't addressed this on the command. For the meantime please install those packages manually: and the command should work. We'll push a fix in the next days.

Ok, unfortunately, the installation still fails. Here's my environment:
Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS (fresh install) 16G RAM, 70GB Disk nlp architect 0.4 (the release version)
Next, I installed the release version 0.4 with this command $ pip3 install -e .
